result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ishmael T Bogan

records.addlTxt:
10:35 AM - Case not called on the Record
Attorney Cristian Farina in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Ishmael T Bogan in court.
Defendant requests additional time to retain counsel.
Court grants.
Hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

11:00 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Ishmael T Bogan in court. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
